summary: The Disclosing Foreign Influence in Lobbying Act (H.R. 1883) amends the Lobbying Disclosure Act of 1995. The bill clarifies the required content of lobbying registrations, specifically requiring disclosure of the name and address of any foreign government or political party, other than the client, that directs, plans, supervises, or controls the registrant's lobbying activities. This aims to increase transparency regarding foreign influence in lobbying efforts.
